SENT.plain: Numerous chromosome abnormalities have been described in myelodysplastic syndromes, but single karyotypic aberrations are much less frequent
We report the case of a 65-year-old woman who presented a trisomy 21 as the sole karyotypic anomaly for a refractory anemia with ring sideroblasts
The nature of such an anomaly is discussed in regard to pathogenesis and prognosis
